metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19854 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 4.19.3.crypto_report_one() and related functions in crypto/crypto_user.c (thecrypto user configuration API) do not fully initialize structures that arecopied to userspace, potentially leaking sensitive memory to user programs.NOTE: this is a CVE-2013-2547 regression but with easier exploitabilitybecause the attacker does not need a capability (however, the system musthave the CONFIG_CRYPTO_USER kconfig option).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-46.49
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-46.49
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-46.49
